body_html:
Thanks Tongzhou.
Yes, I installed python from source, it was the only option according with the official web page of Pytorch if you are using a MacOS with CUDA.
I have finally solved the problem, I reinstall Pytorch as you suggested, however, when I installed again OpenCV I got the same initial errors (shorted):

ImportError dlopen Library not loaded libopenblasp-r0.2.19.dylib
Referenced from libopencv_core.3.3.dylib
Reason image not found

Now, instead of following the above procedure, I have followed the steps suggested at:
conda-forge/staged-recipes#3248
conda-forge/opencv-feedstock#69
that consists to install the version 3.2.0 of OpenCV. Specifically, in my case:

conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda install opencv=3.2.0
conda install -c conda-forge openblas
conda install harfbuzz -c conda-forge
conda install -c conda-forge opencv --override-channels

Now, both Pytorch (with CUDA) and OpenCV are working.

body:
Thanks Tongzhou.
Yes, I installed python from source, it was the only option according with the official web page of Pytorch if you are using a MacOS with CUDA.
I have finally solved the problem, I reinstall Pytorch as you suggested, however, when I installed again OpenCV I got the same initial errors (shorted):

> ImportError dlopen Library not loaded libopenblasp-r0.2.19.dylib
>   Referenced from libopencv_core.3.3.dylib
>   Reason image not found

Now, instead of following the above procedure, I have followed the steps suggested at:
https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/3248
https://github.com/conda-forge/opencv-feedstock/issues/69
that consists to install the version 3.2.0 of OpenCV. Specifically, in my case:
```
conda config --add channels conda-forge
conda install opencv=3.2.0
conda install -c conda-forge openblas
conda install harfbuzz -c conda-forge
conda install -c conda-forge opencv --override-channels
```
Now, both Pytorch (with CUDA) and OpenCV are working.
